item.title: Life On Mars
item.description:
The game will be available at Nationaal Ruimtevaart Museum in Lelystad in July as an interactive exhibit within an space related exhibition. You play as a mars rover and you get to discover and learn about the objects you encounter in your journey.

I was a co developer on the game and worked on aspects such as: camera work, rover controller, map funtion, game and rover restart mechanics, various bug fixes, optimization, sound, animations,
ㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤ

item.title: VR Digital Museum
item.description:
Prototype developed during an internship. The application is a model Viewer meant to be used in museums. In the application you can inspect and go through a set of public statues from Roterdam which were made through photogrametry. It has a modular backend, you can drag and drop models on the web through a cloud service and they get updated in the application. ㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤ

‎

item.title: Flight Procedure Training - Deicing Procedure
item.description:
Prototype made during a University course within a team of 4 where I worked as a programmer. The client of the product was a pilot from Corendon Airlines and our goal was to find out if procedure training in VR can be suitable for procedure training and if it can be used instead of the full-flight simulator.

‎

item.title: Michiel De Ruyter
item.description:
ㅤㅤㅤEarly prototype of a game I worked on during an intership at a small game studio. The game is meant to be an educational VR game that takes you on a journey where you are a sailor subordinated to the admiral Michiel de Ruyter during one of the Anglo-Dutch War. The game takes places on the well-known ‘’zeven provincien’’ ship and you will get to experience what it was like to be a crew member at that time and what were some of the activities they had to do. You will get to find out about his journey to England, how he sank the English fleet.

‎

item.title: Election Brawl
item.description:
This is the prototype of a game that I worked on for a minor(Design, Art and Technology). The game has an unncommon perspective due to the fact that it is meant to be played on a video mapped surface, like a cube in this case. It is a two players fighting game. The players have light attacks (also combos), heavy attacks, they can block and they have a special attack for each president to use after they have filled up the special attack bar.

Team: 2 people.

I was the programmer in the team and also helped out modelling.

item.title: Short Animations
item.description:
ㅤㅤㅤㅤThese 2 short animations were made for a 3D class within a minor (Design, Art and Technology). My learning goal was to learn more about animations while also learning more about Blender. The assets used were not made by me. ㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤ

item.title: Wild Gunners
item.description:
This is a prototype I created while learning to develop for mobile in which I tried to replicate the mechanics of an existing game. ㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤ

item.title: Hoodwink
item.description:
Prototype developed during a University project in a team of 4 where I was the programmer. The game was required to work with only one button as our client suffered from cerebral palsy and is only able to slightly move his head. He has a wheelchair, and that wheelchair has a screen attached in front of it and 2 head side supports that act as buttons if pushed. Because there are not many games optimized for his handicap, we wanted to make a game that is replayable. It’s a puzzle game where you have to find the way out of a maze, sometimes it requires you to put boxes on their corresponding platform so you can open doors. The game has only 10 premade levels but there is a “FreePlay Mode” where you can choose the size of a level and a random maze will be generated. ㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤ

‎

item.title: About
item.description:
Hello there! My name is Teo, and I’m a 23 year old game developer. I am currently living in Groningen, The Netherlands and I am passionate about the game industry and eager to contribute my skils and creativity to this field. I recently completed my degree in Communication, Multimedia, and Game Design from Hanze University of Applied Sciences in Groningen.

My primary focus is on game programming, and I’m proficient in Unity and C#. During my studies, I dedicated myself to mastering C#, but I’m also interested in other areas of game dev.

Feel free to reach out if you have any questions or opportunities you’d like to discuss.

‎
